job_title: Administrative Assistant in Hollywood, FL
pros: Barry University invests in it’s employees and they encourage doing so (providing learning seminars, hosting annual inter-department collaboration and communication, annual feedback surveys, encouraging feedback with your team and supervisors, etc.) The staff are friendly, hospitable, helpful, responsive, and supportive. Mileage reimbursement can be arranged depending on the situation. Many annual events and team building exercises to encourage camaraderie.
cons: Barry hosts many events, and you may be asked to attend events beyond M-F, 9-5, for some of these events. Not a big con, but something to be aware of if you have personal commitments.

review_title: Barry is not what it used to be-- in crisis now; has lots of potential though.
job_title: Director in Miami Shores, FL
pros: In general people are nice, vacation time is very good, sense of community.  Was much better with former President.  Could be a spectacular place if they could get a heart AND be effective.
cons: People in charge, in general have no clue on how to run a university.  Promotions are based on who you know.  Often inept people are hired because the supervisor does not want competition so they hire the less skilled person.  So called "nationwide" searches are not really done.  They will often only interview the person they have chosen without really looking.  Upper management needs to take some courses on how to run a university.  PhD's are often the worst business people/managers.  very chaotic; constant change and brutal behavior do not equal improvement just the appearance that something is happening.  no one is buying the Charade.  It's a shame because it could be a really good place.  HR is useless, tool of those in charge to perpetuate their power.

job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Miami Shores, FL
pros: A majority of the workforce is made up of intelligent, friendly people who are easy to work with.  Most seem to truely want the university to improve, and are genuinely interested in the students welfare.  I built a number of great relationships with fellow peers and students while at this position.  Great benefits.
cons: The faculty are rarely involved with the University outside of teaching classes.  The overall body of students is a mixed bag of hardworking/intelligent to lazy/underprepared.  The campus feel is more on the commuter side, hurting the "collegiate level" feel and culture.  Many students lack any since of pride in the university, and this has only helped to create identity issues for Barry.  The pay is absolutely awful.  Many people, including myself were asked to take on the workload of two to three times the rate in which they are actually compensated, without any aknowledgement or recognition for the extra work they perform.  There is no relief in site, as the university is constantly cutting into department budgets, and with no raises in the near future, the overall morale of university employees will continue to go down.  I also noticed a few individuals in leadership roles, who have their own agenda, and do not have their team or fellow employees best interest in mind.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Miami, FL
pros:
Generous Time Off
Free Education
work/life balance
training if desired
cons:
severely underpaid
huge workload
facilities are old and need to be updated

review_title: Overall it is not a bad place to work for.
job_title: Director in Miami Shores, FL
pros:
The Benefits package is great.
The People are welcoming.
cons:
- Pay is low, below industry standards.
- Upper management is not qualified, Very weak leadership, starting from the President -- This is the main reason why things do not get done properly.
- There is a lack of focus on the "Big Picture".
- Way to many chiefs.. not enough indians.
- A lot of talk, no action.
- Very few opportunities to grow professionally within the University, the majority of people that are in management positions are there because they have been with the company for a number of years... makes them loyal, but not qualified --- People have this notion that because they have been there long enough, that they deserve promotions or better positions.
- Departments do not use technology properly and are afraid that their jobs could be lost if they start using it.

review_title: Heinous Corporate Culture Fraught with Insecure, Inept Individuals
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami Shores, FL
pros:
- I've learned how not to run a business. 
- I've learned that if possible, its best to suss out an individual's security with him or herself and also their level of intelligence before you hire or work with said individual.
cons:
- If someone feels threatened by you, your chances of advancement are nonexistent and you better find armor for your back because the knife is coming sooner rather than later.
- The corporate culture is one that looks down upon part time employees, treats them as spare, unimportant parts.
- An inept senior management incapable of dealing with a shifting educational landscape, including a continuous decline in student enrollment and retention. Thus, there are major cutbacks, restructuring, no raises in years, and job cuts.

job_title: Professor in Miami Shores, FL
pros: This is an educational institution that can offer a caring touch to its student population.    There are some great lasting programs, such as political science, english, legal studies, professional studies, nursing and social work.
cons: The idea that "Barry Cares" needs to be developed.  One of the deans had an extramarital affairs with a subordinate and this lowered the moral of its employees.

job_title: Data Manager in Pembroke Pines, FL
pros: I worked at Barry University for almost seven years.  I only left because I had to relocate.  Barry offered an engaging and challenging work environment, great coworkers, and a real sense of mission and meaning.  The insurance and other benefits were excellent.   They offered a lot of holidays and were always accommodating with requests for leave.  I took full advantage of their tuition assistance program and paid next to nothing for a bachelors and masters degrees.  I would highly recommend working here.
cons: Some business processes are inefficient, but they are always looking to improve.  Salary are below market.

review_title: It was a great place to work and there are plenty of opportunities available to all people. Apply if you like to teach.
job_title: Teaching Assistant in Miami Shores, FL
pros: Friendliness, many opportunities. Workplace is easy-going and the staff is amazing to work with. They are always around to help and are quite flexible when it comes to absences due to emergencies.
cons: Administration is very unorganized. The paperwork took entirely too long. And even, then I wasn't informed that I was even hired. But once that hassle is over, everything is a breeze from there. The good thing is that once you are in the system...you don't have to go through that hassle anymore.

review_title: Summer Camp Counselor at Barry University
job_title: Summer Camp Counselor in Miami, FL
pros: I was a Summer Camp Counselor for the BUCkids Summer Camp Recreational Program at Barry University. I had a blast with the kids & my colleagues. My favorite part was being able to go on all of the field trips for free.
cons: Sometimes you may feel you're doing more work than others when counselors want to hang out in the office all day, but at the end the day, it's a really laid back job to have if you're in-between jobs or you need something to do for the summer.

review_title: Relaxed, friendly environment, but with plenty of growth potential that isn't being seized.
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Miami Shores, FL
pros: Small, friendly environment. Plenty of networking opportunities with constant change of students and faculty. Chance for career growth if you keep an open ear for job openings.
cons: Nepotism. The university is cutting costs everywhere, but spending in questionable ways. Upper management doesn't listen to students or employees. No longer offering contracts to several of their employees, so job security is a concern.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Miami Shores, FL
pros: Barry has a lot of university wide events and extras, you have the  opportunity to take classes and can get a degree.  The benefits are good for a university.
cons: While the salary seems to be on par with other universities, leadership may be lacking depending on the department that you work in.  It seems that there is a lot of in fighting between the departments vying for resources in a mostly tuition driven institution.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Miami, FL
pros: Great support staff and management team. Graduate assistant compensation package overall is strong.
cons: Compensation is not competitive but other benefits such as meals, books, make up for the low salary. Hours vary per position yet compensation seems to be the same across the board for all grad assistants.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami Shores, FL
pros: Great benefits. Depending on what department you work in, it feels more like family as opposed to coworkers and people who are strangers. Use of facilities and wellness classes are free as well as parking which is rare when working at a University.
cons: HR is a terrible department and quite often self-serving. Additionally, the University is having major problems with student retention so it would be surprising if the University had issues staying open.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Miami, FL
pros: Great Tech support. Ability to access everything by remote access. Including class roster, marks, etc
cons: No support for adjunct staff, low wages, no benefits, no commitment to Adjunct staff from one term to the next. May teach one term and not the next. No consistency.

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Miami Shores, FL
pros: The team I work with was excellent, we all cared and take our responsibility serious. We joke and talk, and develop good relationship over time.
cons: If you are in school, it is a bad position to be in as it robes one's of precious sleep, and can take a toll on your grade

job_title: Faculty in Miami, FL
pros: I love teaching at Barry University. The staff and faculty genuinely believe in the power of education; while the students are almost always eager to learn.
cons: I cannot think of any true "cons" for working at Barry University. I supposed, as always, higher salaries would be beneficial.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Tampa, FL
pros: Modern facilities, helpful administrative personnel.  The classroom facilities were well equipped, and the secretarial support was excellent. The environment was comfortable for the students and the teaching personnel.
cons: Failure to provide keys to the facilities to teaching personnel, who worked very late at night when all administrative personnel had already gone home.

job_title: Ajunct Professor in Miami, FL
pros: The students at Barry are absolutely best They are serious learners from diverse backgrounds. These students are happy to be in college and excel in all areas of scholarship.
